resources.string: Amid a formidable rise in coronavirus cases in Delhi, Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal stated that COVID-19 situation in the national capital will be under control in 7-10 days."

NEW DELHI: West Bengal chief minister Mamata Banerjee on Saturday accused the Prime Minister\'s Office (PMO) of humiliating her after a brief meeting with PM Modi over the devastation caused by Cyclone Yaas took a controversial turn. However, the BJP hit back at the TMC supremo and alleged that it was Mamata who had insulted the PM Modi.On Friday, the central government as well as several senior ministers had accused Mamata of skipping the meeting and making PM Modi wait.Addressing the controversy, Mamata said today she felt insulted since BJP leaders and the state governor were called for the cyclone review meeting which was meant to be between her and the Prime Minister."When we reached, meeting had started. They asked us to sit, I asked them to allow us a minute to submit the report. (The) SPG told us that meeting will be after 1 hour. I saw empty chairs in conference room; was told that meeting was between CM and PM but why were there other BJP leaders," the Trinamool chief asked.Mamata further said that she is ready to even touch PM Modi\'s feet for the welfare of the people but won\'t tolerate insults."If Prime Minister asked me to touch his feet for welfare of the people of Bengal, I am ready to do that, but I should not be insulted," she said.Taking a dig at the Prime Minister, Mamata accused Modi of playing "vendetta politics" since he is yet to come to terms with the BJP\'s defeat in the recent West Bengal elections She also urged the Prime Minister to withdraw Friday order recalling the West Bengal chief secretary."There should be some courtesy. The Centre is not letting the state work. Bengal is my priority and ll never put it in danger. I will remain a security guard for the people here," she said.The West Bengal chief minister added that the tweets posted by several senior ministers over the issue were meant to "tarnish her image".

Whether it’s the latest government policies or shakeups in bollywood, we get them covered and delivered super fast! Get updated with the latest news and current affairs in a jiffy!
